intro: Stemmodontia carnosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Stemmodontia carnosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
